title: What is a TROC Filesystem, and how do I mount it?
content:
I decompiled a piece of firmware using binwalk and found an entry for a TROC Filesystem : 

 DECIMAL       HEXADECIMAL     DESCRIPTION
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1064340       0x103D94        Copyright string: "Copyright 2006 Techsonic Industries, Inc. - All Rights Reserved"
 1084664       0x108CF8        Copyright string: "Copyright 2007 Techsonic Industries, Inc. - All Rights Reserved"
 1211854       0x127DCE        TROC filesystem, 256 file entries
 1671429       0x198105        eCos RTOS string reference: "ecosonda"
 1735998       0x1A7D3E        eCos RTOS string reference: "ecoscandaglio"

While I have seen a number of blogs that got a similar output, none of them seem to actually identify what TROC stands for, or how to mount it. Any ideas?

comments.text: Where is the firmware from and what device is it for?

You should probably have included some more information that you know already about the firmware, but a cursory research using web searches seems to suggest some relation to Linksys firmwares in particular. Going by this it doesn't look exactly difficult to interpret. But what TROC stands for other than The Rest of Canada I could not find.
